message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS 

The paper deals with statistical learning theory and its application to natural language processing tasks. The focus is on domain adaptation, which is a common problem in machine learning. The paper presents a statistical formulation of the problem and proposes a solution based on maximum entropy classifiers and their linear chain counterparts. The experimental results show that the approach leads to improved performance on real-world tasks. Given the focus on machine learning and natural language processing, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Other likely sub-categories include cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision), and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
